pkgmetadata.longdescription: # pyclickThis is a library for generating human-like mouse movements.The movements are based on the concept of bezier curve:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B%C3%A9zier_curve### Simple Example:```from pyclick import HumanClicker# initialize HumanClicker objecthc = HumanClicker()# move the mouse to position (100,100) on the screen in approximately 2 secondshc.move((100,100),2)# mouse click(left button)hc.click()```You can also customize the mouse curve by passing a HumanCurve to HumanClicker. You can control:- number of internal knots, to change the overall shape of the curve,- distortion to simulate shivering,- tween to simulate acceleration and speed of movement
